name: gut-extension
description: Run GUT(Godot Unit Test) tests from VSCode.

gut-extension.additionalOptions.description: Additional Godot and/or GUT options to use when running GUT.  The default is the debug option for Godot (-d).  See the GUT wiki for more options https://github.com/bitwes/Gut/wiki/Command-Line

gut-extension.discardTerminal.description: Subsequent launches of GUT will discard the existing terminal window and create a new one.  When not checked you must kill Godot manually if an error occurs.

gut-extension.shell.description: The shell to use when running GUT.  Leave blank to use the default shell.  Does not affect running through debugger.

gut-extension.godotOverridePath.description:
GUT uses the godot-tools extension to get the path to the appropriate Godot executable when running tests.  When this is set, it will be used instead of the godot3 or godot4 path configured in godot-tools.  This is useful if you are windows and want to use a Unix shell.

It is recommended you set this per workspace if you work in Godot 3 and Godot 4 projects since it will be used regardless of project version.

scripts.pretest: npm run compile && npm run lint
